availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John B. Nickell (Wolfe County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Wolfe County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Baker Nickell. Father of Priscilla Nickell, Frances Elizabeth Nickell, Robert Nickell, Mary Nickell, Andrew Nickell, Henry Nickell, Jane Nickell, Frances Nickell, Perlina Nickell, and Joseph Nickell. Farmer in Morgan County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Morgan County in 1860. Recommended as a justice of the peace in Wolfe County in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Morgan County, p. 152B-153A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Morgan County, Division 2, p. 357-68.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wolfe County, Precinct 2, p. 410B.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #32733.
"John B. Nickell (1816-1891)," Find A Grave, Memorial #21137352, accessed December 12, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/21137352.
KYR-0001-031-0067.
